news.title: Liberal Lowlife: Mark Kelly
news.text:
The senior Senator from Arizona is the perfect contrast between resume and execution. On paper, the bald phallus model has the ideal life. He was a fighter pilot, he was an astronaut and the attempted murder of his wife by a crazed leftist brings in a lot of sympathy too. But his character made him lose out to being chosen as running mate for Kamala Harris to a guy who lied about his military service and his even his high school football coaching job.

How big a scumbag do you have to be to lose out to a guy who lied about his rank and serving in combat? As you might imagine, it involves his fidelity to something important, and it isn’t the truth.

These are just rumors, of course, as far as the general public knows. The Harris campaign paid people to dig beneath the rumors; what they found remains their little secret. It is, however, worthy of note that while they have expressed disappointment over picking Fraudie Murphy, Minnesota Governor Tim Walz, no one has ever expressed regret about NOT picking Mark Kelly. It’s the difference between being upset over your fantasy football quarterback being injured in week one and using your first round draft pick to choose Arron Hernandez.

Kelly might be the only person I’ve ever heard brag about their service in the first Gulf War. Not that there wasn’t danger or it is something those who served shouldn’t be proud of, but it was very short and the Iraqi military turned out to be significantly less a threat than was publicly thought prior to the war.

Still, Kelly did fly his planes and drop his bombs, so there’s that. Still, he talks about it like it was Midway.

Then he went to space, which is cool. He delivered a lot of cargo as a Space Shuttle pilot. I’ve never heard any other Space Shuttle pilot talk about their service like they’d cured a disease like Kelly does, they downplay it. It’s not like being an intergalactic Door Dasher, but still…

Kelly then retired from NASA to focus on his family, especially since his wife had been horribly injured when a lunatic tried to kill her at a public event. He wanted to help her write her book and focus on spending time with his family, according to him at the time.

After a few years, Kelly made a bunch of money off China and had had enough of his family, so he decided to run for the Senate on his biography and the attack on his wife. He won because his biography, on paper, is impressive, and the attack on his wife was horrible.

Since winning, Mark Kelly has served without distinction. A few self-serving laws regarding Arizona Indian tribes and “co-sponsoring” bills that became law – which is literally the least a Member of Congress can do – and that’s about all he’s done.

He is still milking his military service, only this time in an attempt to undermine the chain of command. It’s gross, really.

Mark Kelly now spends his days kissing the asses of wealthy Democrat donors, sucking up to celebrities and trying to bilk poor people out of what remains on their high-interest credit cards in the hope of running for president in 2028. See, while being a sketchy guy with low character is a disqualifying trait as a running mate, there is no background check when it comes to winning a party’s nomination.

All the while, he ducks behind his disabled wife every time righteous and justified criticism is hurled his way. It’s gross. He’s gross. He’s also the most frequent emailer to fundraising lists on the left.

He has sent 13 emails begging for money since December 2nd, with subject lines like “I will not give up on our country” and “President Trump is calling for me to be hanged.” The bald bag of douche is desperate to exploit his popularity among the hate America crowd. It’s hard to feel bad for morons being conned out of their money, but it does add a level of scumbagery when the guy doing it spends his time insisting he’s a hero, a sentiment no person not on his payroll appears to share.

Mark Kelly is the perfect Democrat: a shameless self-promoter, perfectly willing to take money from anyone, shady and sleazy business and personal history and quick to duck behind his wife when anyone calls him out on any of it. I’d peg Kelly’s chances of securing the Democratic nomination at this point at about 27 percent.

Derek Hunter is the host of the Derek Hunter Show on WMAL in Washington, DC, and has a free daily podcast (subscribe!) and author of the book, Outrage, INC., which exposes how liberals use fear and hatred to manipulate the masses, and host of the weekly “Week in F*cking Review” podcast where the news is spoken about the way it deserves to be. Follow him on Twitter at @DerekAHunter.
news.author: Derek Hunter

news.title: Son arrested after Rob Reiner and wife found dead in LA home
news.text:
Rob Reiner’s son, Nick Reiner, has been taken into custody after the deaths of the director-writer and his wife Michele, a law enforcement official told the Associated Press.
The official confirmed the 32-year-old was in police custody on Monday. The official could not publicly discuss details of the investigation and spoke on condition of anonymity.
Online jail records show Reiner was booked by Los Angeles police and remained in jail on Monday. It was not immediately clear what charges he would face. The online records showed a US$4 million bail had been set.
Representatives for Reiner’s family did not immediately respond to a request for comment and it was not immediately clear if Nick Reiner had a lawyer who could speak on his behalf.
Long-time director Reiner, 78, and his wife, 68, were found dead in their Los Angeles home on Sunday in what police had described as an apparent homicide.

A spokesperson for the Reiner family confirmed the deaths on Sunday evening.
“It is with profound sorrow that we announce the tragic passing of Michele and Rob Reiner,” the family spokesperson said in a statement. “We are heartbroken by this sudden loss, and we ask for privacy during this unbelievably difficult time.”
Law enforcement sources had told The Los Angeles Times that a family member was being interviewed in connection with the deaths.
The sources, who were not authorised to speak publicly about the ongoing investigation, confirmed that there was no sign of forced entry into the home.
Detectives with the Robbery Homicide Division were investigating an “apparent homicide” at Reiner’s home, said Captain Mike Bland with the Los Angeles Police Department (LAPD).
At a press conference late on Sunday, LAPD Chief Detective Alan Hamilton released little information about the case.
He said officers were working to secure a search warrant before launching a “thorough” investigation inside the residence.
“At this time, the Los Angeles Police Department is not seeking anyone as a suspect or as a person of interest … and we will not be doing that until we conduct our investigation and we move forward,” Hamilton said.
He said many family members would be interviewed but that “no one has been detained; no one is being questioned as a suspect”.

“We are going to try to speak to every family member that we can to get to the facts of this investigation.”
Earlier Sunday, Margaret Stewart, a Los Angeles Fire Department spokesman, said the department was called to the residence around 3.30pm for medical aid. Inside the home, the two bodies were found.
Reiner had a five-decade-long career in Hollywood.
Early in his career, he played Michael “Meathead” Stivic on the iconic sitcom All in the Family from 1971 to 1979, alongside Carroll O’Connor as Archie Bunker.
As a director, Reiner helmed a string of hits including When Harry Met Sally, The Princess Bride and This Is Spinal Tap. His work took a dramatic turn when he directed the 1986 adaptation of Stephen King’s novella Stand by Me.
Reiner was nominated for an Academy Award for 1993’s A Few Good Men, which starred Jack Nicholson and Tom Cruise, though the movie lost to Clint Eastwood’s western Unforgiven.
Reiner, a native of New York City and son of the late comedy writer and actor Carl Reiner, was also well known for his political activism.

In the 2004 presidential election, he backed Democratic candidate John Kerry and featured in advertisements taking aim at incumbent President George W. Bush. Reiner also supported Democratic presidential hopefuls Al Gore and Hillary Clinton.
Reiner was married to Penny Marshall, star of Laverne & Shirley, from 1971 to 1981. He met Michele Singer on the set of When Harry Met Sally and the two married in 1989, the year the movie came out.
Michele began producing films over the last decade, including Shock and Awe, Albert Brooks: Defending My Life and Spinal Tap II: The End Continues, all directed by her husband. She also produced God & Country, a look at Christian nationalism in the US.
Before her production career, she was a photographer who captured the image of Donald Trump that appears on the cover of his book Trump: The Art of the Deal.
The deaths drew condolences from political heavyweights like California Governor Newsom, former US Vice-President Kamala Harris and former US President Barack Obama, as well as entertainment industry figures.
“Rob will be remembered for his remarkable filmography and for his extraordinary contribution to humanity,” Newsom said on X, adding he was “heartbroken by the tragic loss”.
Killings are rare in the Brentwood neighbourhood. The scene is a short distance from the home where O.J. Simpson’s wife Nicole Brown Simpson and her friend Ron Goldman were killed in 1994.
By Sunday evening, law enforcement had swarmed Reiner’s sprawling estate, though an eerie quiet hung over Chadbourne Avenue, which had been sealed from the public with yellow crime scene tape.
Police cars were stationed at either end of the block where the Reiner residence is located while a helicopter circled overhead.
Additional reporting by Associated Press, Reuters and Agence France-Presse
news.summary:
Rob Reiner’s son, Nick Reiner, has been taken into custody after the deaths of the director-writer and his wife Michele, a law enforcement official told the Associated Press.
The official confirmed the 32-year-old was in police custody on Monday. The official could not publicly discuss details of the investigation and spoke on condition of anonymity.
Online jail records show Reiner was booked by Los Angeles police and remained in jail on Monday. It was not immediately clear what charges he would...
news.author: Tribune News Service

news.title: Rob Reiner, his wife killed in apparent homicide — Live updates
news.text:
Rob Reiner, the acclaimed Hollywood director and actor, was killed alongside his wife, Michele Singer, in their California home, according to Variety and TMZ.

Their deaths are under investigation by the Los Angeles Police Department after the couple was found in their home in Brentwood.

USA TODAY was unable to reach a representative for Reiner at the time of publication.

Follow along for updates.

Cary Elwes and other stars pay tribute to Rob Reiner

Care Elwes, who played Westley in "Princess Bride," posted a black and white photo presumably from the set of the film with two empty director's chairs, one with his name on it and one with Reiner's name. The slow melody of the movie played, and the caption was simply, "No words..."

James Woods, star of "Ghosts of Mississippi," posted on X: "Rob and I remained good friends ever since we made GHOSTS OF MISSISSIPPI. The studio didn’t think I was old enough to do the part, but Rob fought for me. Political differences never stood in the way of our love and respect for each other. I am devastated by this terrible event."

Corey Feldman, who starred in "Stand by Me," also posted on X: "OMG THIS IS HORRIBLE NEWS! IM SO SORRY 4 ROB & HIS WIFE, & THEIR CHILDREN & THE WHOLE REINER FAMILY! ALL I CAN SAY IS IM SHOCKED & SADDENED, BUT I #LOVE U ROB! U WILL B 4EVER MISSED!"

Sean Ono Lennon posted, "Please not Rob Reiner. He is one of the greatest of all time."

Barack Obama mourns Rob Reiner 

The former president wrote on X Sunday that he and Michelle are "heartbroken by the tragic passing of Rob Reiner and his beloved wife, Michele."

"Rob's achievements in film and television gave us some of our most cherished stories on screen," he wrote. "But beneath all of the stories he produced was a deep belief in the goodness of people—and a lifelong commitment to putting that belief into action. Together, he and his wife lived lives defined by purpose. They will be remembered for the values they championed and the countless people they inspired. We send our deepest condolences to all who loved them."

Kamala Harris said Reiner and his wife 'loved each other very much'

The former U.S. vice president also shared a tribute on social media in light of Reiner's death. 

She remembered the director as someone whose work "has impacted generations of Americans. The characters, dialogue, and visuals he brought to life in film and television are woven throughout our culture." 

Harris continued, "Rob loved our country, cared deeply about the future of our nation, and fought for America's democracy. Rob and his wife Michele loved each other very much. They were dear friends, and Doug and I are devastated to learn of their passing."

Christopher Guest and Jamie Lee Curtis are 'numb' over the loss of their 'great friends'

In a statement to USA TODAY, the actors said they "are numb and sad and shocked about the violent, tragic deaths of our dear friends Rob and Michelle Singer Reiner and our ONLY focus and care right now is for their children and immediate families and we will offer all support possible to help them.

 "There will be plenty of time later to discuss the creative lives we shared and the great political and social impact they both had on the entertainment industry, early childhood development, the fight for gay marriage and their global care for a world in crisis."

They closed their statement by simply saying, "We have lost great friends. Please give us time to grieve."

Rob Reiner’s family breaks silence on director’s death

According to CNN, a spokesperson for the Reiner family said late Sunday evening that the couple have died.

They described their death as "tragic" and asked for privacy.

"It is with profound sorrow that we announce the tragic passing of Michele and Rob Reiner. We are heartbroken by this sudden loss, and we ask for privacy during this unbelievably difficult time," the spokesperson said in a statement.

No further details were given.

Nancy Pelosi mourns the death of Rob Reiner and his wife

In a post on X, Rep. Nancy Pelosi - whose husband was attacked in 2022 in their home - called the news of Reiner and his wife’s death "devastating."

"It’s hard to think of anyone more remarkable and excellent in every field and endeavor they pursued," she said in a post to X. "Rob was creative, funny, and beloved. And in all of their endeavors, Michelle was his indispensable partner, intellectual resource, and a loving wife."

Governor Gavin Newsom and Mayor Karen Bass paid tribute to the director

The California governor said he and his wife were "heartbroken" by the loss of Rob Reiner and Michele Singer. "Rob was the big-hearted genius behind so many of the classic stories we love," he posted on X. "His boundless empathy made his stories timeless, teaching generations how to see goodness and righteousness in others – and encouraging us to dream bigger."

L.A. Mayor Bass called the loss "devastating," posting on X that Rob Reiner "improved countless lives through his creative work and advocacy fighting for social and economic justice. An acclaimed actor, director, producer, writer, and engaged political activist, he always used his gifts in service of others. ... Among his numerous contributions, Rob helped create First 5 California, a landmark initiative funded by a tobacco tax to support early childhood development programs. He and Michele fought for early childhood development and marriage equality, working to overturn Proposition 8. They were true champions for LGBTQ+ rights." I want to thank all of the first responders who were called to this tragic event. The investigation is ongoing." She added, "I'm holding all who loved Rob and Michele in my heart."

LAPD will continue investigating

In a press conference on Sunday night, LAPD said the robbery-homicide division will continue to investigate through the night and expect to release more information in the morning. They announced they are not seeking anyone as a suspect or person of interest. But they added that no one has been detained at this time. Authorities did confirm that "many family members" will be interviewed in the course of their work and that they were obtaining a search warrant to conduct a full crime scene investigation. They did not comment on the injuries sustained by the deceased.

Rob Reiner, wife Michele killed by their son Nick: report

According to People, the couple was allegedly killed by their son, Nick Reiner, 32. USA TODAY has not been able to independently confirm this information. The New York Post also reported Nick was a person of interest in the case and ET also cited sources that he was allegedly involved.

Rob Reiner had been open about son's battle with addiction

In a 2016 interview with TODAY, the director spoke about the film "Being Charlie," his most personal directorial effort yet. 

Co-written with Nick, the film traces a young man's descent into and out of drug addiction."Being Charlie," starring Nick Robinson, Common, Ricardo Chavira and Morgan Saylor screened at the 2015 Toronto International Film Festival and was released on May 6, 2016. 

"It was very personal," Reiner told TODAY at the time, adding that, "What I didn't understand is the depth of what [Nick] was going through." 

The film follows an 18-year-old Charlie who has been in and out of rehab for years. Drawing parallels between the real-life father-son duo, Charlie's father in the film is a former Hollywood star. 

Reiner and his wife were found by their daughter 

Also according to People, the director and his wife were found dead in their Los Angeles home by their daughter, Romy.

Reports surface of two people dead in Rob Reiner's home

Two people were found dead in the Brentwood home of Hollywood director Rob Reiner on Sunday, Dec. 14, authorities confirmed to USA TODAY.

The Los Angeles Fire Department told USA TODAY on Sunday, Dec. 14, that paramedics were called to the home on the 200 block of Chadbourne at around 3:30 p.m. local time. LAFD said a man and a woman were found deceased inside the home, and their ages were approximately 78 and 68.

The Los Angeles Police Department later confirmed the same to USA TODAY.

"Once inside the residency, officers discovered two decedents," LAPD said in their statement, adding that "the identity of the decedents has not yet been confirmed." But according to Variety and TMZ, Reiner and his wife, Michele Singer, 68, were identified as the victims.

LAPD also told USA TODAY that the Robbery Homicide Division was also responding to the residence.

According to NBC Los Angeles earlier Sunday, there was a heavy police presence at the residence. Neighbors told the local news outlet that Reiner and his wife live in the home.

Who is Rob Reiner?

Reiner, 78, son of comedy legend Carl Reiner, is a director, producer, screenwriter and actor, who has worked on "The Princess Bride," "When Harry Met Sally," TV's "All in the Family," the cult classic "This Is Spinal Tap" and "Spinal Tap II: The End Continues."

Reiner is married to producer Michele Singer Reiner, and the pair shares three children. The director has a child from his first marriage to "A League of Their Own" director Penny Marshall, who died in 2018.

Most recently, Reiner appeared in Hulu’s "The Bear."
news.author: Usa Today
